program main

    implicit none

    integer :: a(5), r(5), max_b, last_a, ans1, i, r_i, b
    integer :: MOD = 1000000007
    character(len=20) :: s
    integer :: len, dp(0:19, 0:12), base, ans2, digit, next_digit, pre, new_rem
    integer :: N, count, temp, ans3

    ! First program's logic
    read*, a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4), a(5)

    max_b = -1
    last_a =0

    do i=1,5
        r_i = mod(a(i),10) if (r_i /=0) then
            b = 10 - r_i
            if (b > max_b) then
                max_b = b
                last_a = a(i)
            else if (b == max_b) then
                last_a = a(i)
            end if
        end if
    end do

    if (max_b == -1) then
        ans1 = sum(a(1:5))
    else
        ans1 =0
        do i=1,5
            if (a(i) == last_a) cycle
            r_i = mod(a(i),10) if (r_i ==0) then
                ans1 = ans1 + a(i)
            else
                ans1 = ans1 + a(i) + (10 - r_i)
            end if
        end do
        ans1 = ans1 + last_a
    end if

    ! Convert ans1 to string
    write(s, '(i0)') ans1
    len = len_trim(s)

    ! Second program's logic
    dp = 0
    base =1

    do i=0, len-1
        character(1) :: current_char
        current_char = s(len -i)  ! since s is 1-based, len -i gives the correct position

        if (current_char == '?') then
            do next_digit=0,9
                do pre=0,12
                    if (i ==0) then
                        prev_count = 0
                        if (pre ==0) prev_count =1
                    else
                        prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)
                    end if
                    new_rem = mod( base * next_digit + pre, 13 )
                    dp(i, new_rem) = mod( dp(i, new_rem) + prev_count, MOD )
                end do
            end do
        else
            digit = ichar(current_char) - ichar('0')
            do pre=0,12
                if (i ==0) then
                    prev_count =0
                    if (pre ==0) prev_count =1
                else
                    prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)
                end if
                new_rem = mod( base * digit + pre, 13 )
                dp(i, new_rem) = mod( dp(i, new_rem) + prev_count, MOD )
            end do
        end if

        base = mod( base *10, 13 ) end do

    ans2 = dp(len-1,5)

    ! Third program's logic
    N = ans2
    count =0
    temp = N
    do while (temp >0)
        count = count +1
        temp = temp /10
    end do

    ans3 =0
    do i=1, count
        if (i == count) then
            if (mod(i,2) ==1) then
                ans3 = ans3 + (N - 10**(i-1) +1)
            end if
        else
            if (i ==1) then
                ans3 = ans3 +9
            else if (mod(i,2) ==1) then
                ans3 = ans3 + (10**i - 10**(i-1))
            end

end program main

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: a(5), r(5), max_b, last_a, ans1, i, r_i, b
    integer :: MOD = 1000000007
    character(len=20) :: s
    integer :: len, dp(0:19, 0:12), base, ans2, digit, next_digit, pre, new_rem
    integer :: N, count, temp, ans3

    ! First program's logic
    read*, a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4), a(5)

    max_b = -1
    last_a =0

    do i=1,5
        r_i = mod(a(i),10)
        if (r_i /=0) then
            b = 10 - r_i
            if (b > max_b) then
                max_b = b
                last_a = a(i)
            else if (b == max_b) then
                last_a = a(i)
            end if
        end if
    end do

    if (max_b == -1) then
        ans1 = sum(a(1:5))
    else
        ans1 =0
        do i=1,5
            if (a(i) == last_a) cycle
            r_i = mod(a(i),10)
            if (r_i ==0) then
                ans1 = ans1 + a(i)
            else
                ans1 = ans1 + a(i) + (10 - r_i)
            end if
        end do
        ans1 = ans1 + last_a
    end if

    ! Convert ans1 to string
    write(s, '(i0)') ans1
    len = len_trim(s)

    ! Second program's logic
    dp = 0
    base =1

    do i=0, len-1
        character(1) :: current_char
        current_char = s(len -i)  ! since s is 1-based, len -i gives the correct position

        if (current_char == '?') then
            do next_digit=0,9
                do pre=0,12
                    if (i ==0) then
                        prev_count = 0
                        if (pre ==0) prev_count =1
                    else
                        prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)
                    end if
                    new_rem = mod( base * next_digit + pre, 13 )
                    dp(i, new_rem) = mod( dp(i, new_rem) + prev_count, MOD )
                end do
            end do
        else
            digit = ichar(current_char) - ichar('0')
            do pre=0,12
                if (i ==0) then
                    prev_count =0
                    if (pre ==0) prev_count =1
                else
                    prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)
                end if
                new_rem = mod( base * digit + pre, 13 )
                dp(i, new_rem) = mod( dp(i, new_rem) + prev_count, MOD )
            end do
        end if

        base = mod( base *10, 13 )
    end do

    ans2 = dp(len-1,5)

    ! Third program's logic
    N = ans2
    count =0
    temp = N
    do while (temp >0)
        count = count +1
        temp = temp /10
    end do

    ans3 =0
    do i=1, count
        if (i == count) then
            if (mod(i,2) ==1) then
                ans3 = ans3 + (N - 10**(i-1) +1)
            end if
        else
            if (i ==1) then
                ans3 = ans3 +9
            else if (mod(i,2) ==1) then
                ans3 = ans3 + (10**i - 10**(i-1))
            end if
        end if
    end do

    print*, ans3

end program main
